SEARCH
Package com.api.synco.module.user.application.controller

Class UserController

java.lang.Object
com.api.synco.module.user.application.controller.UserController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/api/users") public class UserController extends Object
REST controller for user management operations.

This controller provides endpoints for creating, reading, updating, and deleting users in the system. All endpoints require authentication via JWT.

The controller supports:

  • User creation with role assignment
  • User deletion (with permission checks)
  • User profile editing
  • User retrieval by ID
  • Paginated user listing with filters
Since:
1.0.0
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Luca5Eckert

    • UserController

      public UserController(UserService userService, UserAuthenticationService authenticationService)
      Constructs a new user controller.
      Parameters:

      authenticationService - the service for accessing authenticated user information

  • Method Details

    • create

      @PostMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<CustomApiResponse<UserCreateResponse>> create(@RequestBody @Valid @Valid UserCreateRequest userCreateRequest)
      Creates a new user in the system.

      This endpoint requires administrative privileges. The authenticated user must have permission to create new users.

      Parameters:
      userCreateRequest - the request containing user data
      Returns:
      the created user data with HTTP 201 status

    • delete

      @DeleteMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<CustomApiResponse<String>> delete(@RequestBody @Valid @Valid UserDeleteRequest userDeleteRequest)
      Deletes a user from the system.

      Only users with appropriate permissions can delete other users. A user cannot delete themselves if they are the last administrator.

      Parameters:
      userDeleteRequest - the request containing the user ID to delete
      Returns:
      success message with HTTP 202 status

    • edit

      @PatchMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<CustomApiResponse<UserEditResponse>> edit(@RequestBody @Valid @Valid UserEditRequest userEditRequest)
      Updates an existing user's information.

      Only users with appropriate permissions can edit other users' profiles. Users can always edit their own profile information.

      Parameters:
      userEditRequest - the request containing updated user data
      Returns:
      the updated user data with HTTP 202 status

    • get

      @GetMapping("/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<CustomApiResponse<UserGetResponse>> get(@PathVariable("id") long id)
      Retrieves a specific user by their unique identifier.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier of the user to retrieve
      Returns:
      the user data with HTTP 200 status

    • getAll

      @GetMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<CustomApiResponse<List<UserGetResponse>>> getAll(@RequestParam(value="name",required=false) String name, @RequestParam(value="email",required=false) String email, @RequestParam(value="role",required=false) RoleUser role, @RequestParam(value="createAt",required=false) Instant createAt, @RequestParam(value="updateAt",required=false) Instant updateAt, @RequestParam(value="page",defaultValue="0") int pageNumber, @RequestParam(value="size",defaultValue="10") int pageSize)
      Retrieves a paginated list of users with optional filters.

      This endpoint supports filtering by:

      • Name (partial match, case-insensitive)
      • Email (partial match, case-insensitive)
      • Role (exact match)
      • Creation date range
      Parameters:
      name - filter by name containing this value (optional)
      email - filter by email containing this value (optional)
      role - filter by user role (optional)
      createAt - filter users created from this date onwards (optional)
      updateAt - filter users updated up to this date (optional)
      pageNumber - the page number to retrieve (0-based)
      pageSize - the number of users per page
      Returns:
      a list of users matching the criteria
